Queue Screen¶

Contains the functions needed on the screen screen_queue.

screen_queue.choose_file_to_import(button)[source]¶

Opens an instance of MDFileManager so the user can choose a file to import.

Binds function to clicking on file, so the import is started in separate thread.

screen_queue.choose_replacements_dialog(replacements)[source]¶

Displays possible replacements.

Opens an MDDialog to show possible suggestions for detected non-dictionary forms of words.

screen_queue.click_on_done_item(item)[source]¶

Placeholder for later implementation.

screen_queue.click_on_error_item(item)[source]¶

Placeholder for later implementation.

screen_queue.click_on_queue_item(item)[source]¶

Switch to screen_single_word to generate a card for the clicked word.

screen_queue.import_from(path, source='kindle')[source]¶

Imports, processes and queues words from file.

If non-dictionary forms are detected, prompts the user with suggestions for replacement.

Parameters

  • path – Path to file.

  • source – Type of source. Options=[“kindle”,”txt”] (Default value = “kindle”)

screen_queue.is_duplicate(word)[source]¶

Checks if word is already queued, done or has caused an error.

Parameters

word – Word to check.

Returns

True if word is already in app.queue_words, app.error_words or app.done_words. Else False.

screen_queue.options_dict[source]¶

{"icon-name":"hint text"} for the contents of MDFloatingActionButtonSpeedDial.

Type

dict

screen_queue.pause_downloading()[source]¶

Empties queue.

This leads the download to stop after the current word is processed.

screen_queue.queue_word(word)[source]¶

Adds the word to the app.queue_words list and Queue and changes state to “queued”. Then calls start_downloading().

Parameters

word – Word to add to queue.

screen_queue.start_downloading()[source]¶

Downloads data for queued words:

  • Sets up Queue

  • If no worker is present, starts one.

screen_queue.start_workers(worker_fn, num)[source]¶

Starts a number of workers in separate threads

Parameters

  • worker_fn – Function to be started

  • num – Number of threads/workers

screen_queue.worker_single_word()[source]¶

As long as the queue is not empty, tries to process a single word. Changing the states accordingly to “loading” and “ready” If it fails, it moves the word to the error_words list.
